author: manunlp
content:
I used images of this config.
(But at the moment only Prysm<>LH and Prysm<>Teku.)
I did not yet tested Prysm<>Grandine neither more than 2 clients at the same time.

author: agnxsh
content: <@592004585506340885> i think it might be a good idea to have `upgradeToFulu` spec tests

author: manunlp
content: We might think `upgradeToFulu` is so trivial that we don't need spectest. But at least Prysm (and maybe Nimbus) got it wrong at the first implementation. So I agree with the need of spectests.

content: Grandine<>Prysm

author: manunlp
content: Nice! By any chance, do you fetch pprof heap with a cron as we discussed last week? (To track Prysm slow memory leak)

author: parithosh
content: cc <@131476523050860545> , i forgot which s3 bucket you were sending it to üòÖ

author: skylenet
content: It's not in a bucket. It's on a volume on the k8s cluster. As long as you didn't kill the cluster, it should be there. Instruction on top in here: https://gist.github.com/skylenet/19817d552de1ae90b463410079c9c78d

author: skylenet
content: ugh, seems like it got deleted?

author: parithosh
content:
ah damn :/
sorry about that - force of habit to clean experiment before a new one and i forgot about the pprof thing running there! could you deploy the same against the new enclave?

author: skylenet
content: yeah. all good. I just deployed the cronjob again.

author: skylenet
content: It's doing a dump every hour. You should be able to see something after some time by doing `kubectl -n kt-watchful-cliff exec -it $(kubectl -n ${KT_NAMESPACE} get pods -l app=pprof-debug -o jsonpath='{.items[0].metadata.name}') -- /bin/bash -c "ls -l /dumps"`

author: jimmygchen
content: Is this with 12s slots? on my laptop - been running the 4 clients overnight, and still at 100% (12s slots). Is Grandine mainly struggling with shorter slot times?
